channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: CFPB Calls for Limits, $120 Million Fine Against Navient for Student Loan Practices
item.description: The regulator’s proposed order could permanently ban Navient from servicing federal direct loans.

item.title: Kroger’s stock jumps 6% after profit beat though CEO says more affluent customer now also wary on spending
item.description: Kroger’s CEO says the company is still committed to closing its merger with Albertsons, despite regulatory pushback.

item.title: The Brawl Taking Shape Over Pfizer's Multibillion-Dollar Heart Monopoly
item.description: The drugmaker’s fastest-growing blockbuster could soon face competition from two biotech firms in the treatment of a little-known heart condition.

item.title: Mortgage rates are falling ahead of the Fed’s planned rate cut. How borrowers can capitalize.
item.description: The 30-year mortgage rate is averaging at 6.2% Freddie Mac said in its latest weekly survey on Thursday.

item.title: Falling Interest Rates May Be a Challenge for JPMorgan but Not for Everyone
item.description: Some banks may still see rising net interest income even if the Federal Reserve slashes rates as anticipated.

item.title: AST SpaceMobile launches first five commercial satellites, but stock slides
item.description: Space-based broadband company AST SpaceMobile launched its first five commercial satellites into space atop a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket early Thursday.

item.title: Megamerger of European Banks Still Wouldn't Challenge Wall Street
item.description: A potential combination of Italy’s UniCredit with Germany’s Commerzbank would be big, but not big enough to create a European banking champion.

item.title: ‘I have zero regrets’: I’m 84 and estranged from my two adult sons. My 48-year-old wife will get my seven-figure estate. Is that selfish?
item.description: “My will and trust will exclude everyone that carries my family name.”

item.title: Investors Adopt Defensive Crouch Ahead of Fed Rate Cut
item.description: The utilities sector is neck and neck with tech as 2024’s best performing group.

item.title: GE Vernova’s stock reverses toward new highs after an update on profitability
item.description: GE Vernova’s stock pulled an intraday U-turn to trade at fresh highs on Thursday, after the renewable-energy company trimmed its outlook for third-qua...
